javadoc:
This is a generalized class for storing register values over ranges.  The values include mask bits
 to indicate which bits within the register are being set.  The mask is stored along with the
 value so the getValue method can indicate back which bits in the value are valid.  If existing
 values already exist at an address, the values are combined according to the masks.  Any new value
 bits that have their associated mask bits on will overwrite any existing bits and the new mask will
 be anded to the existing mask.  Other bits will not be affected.
 
 This class takes a RangeMapAdapter that will adapt to some lower level storage.  There are current
 two implementations - one that uses an ObjectRangeMap for storing register values in memory and
 the other that uses RangeMapDB for storing register values in the database.

methods.javadoc:
Constructs a new RegisterValueStore.
@param rangeMap the rangeMapAdapter that handles the low level storage of byte arrays
methods.name: <init>

params.name: rangeMap
params.comment: the rangeMapAdapter that handles the low level storage of byte arrays

methods.name: moveAddressRange
methods.comment: Move all register values within an address range to a new range.

params.name: fromAddr
params.comment: the first address of the range to be moved.

params.name: toAddr
params.comment: the address where to the range is to be moved.

params.name: length
params.comment: the number of addresses to move.

throws.comment: if the user canceled the operation via the task monitor.

methods.name: setValue
methods.comment:
Sets the given register value (contains value and mask) across the given address range.  Any
 existing values in the range that have values that are not part of the input mask are 
 not changed.

params.name: start
params.comment: the start of the range to set the register value.

params.name: end
params.comment: the end of the range(inclusive) to set the register value.

methods.javadoc: Delete all stored values and free/delete underlying storage.
methods.name: clearAll
methods.comment: Delete all stored values and free/delete underlying storage.

methods.name: clearValue
methods.comment:
Clears the address range of any set bits using the mask from the given register value.
 existing values in the range that have values that are not part of the input mask are 
 not changed. If register is null, just clear all the values in range

params.name: start
params.comment: the start of the range to clear the register value bits.

params.name: end
params.comment: the end of the range(inclusive) to clear the register value bits.

params.name: register
params.comment: the register whos mask to use.  If null, clear all values in the given range.

methods.name: getValue
methods.comment: Returns the RegisterValue (value and mask) associated with the given address.

params.name: address
params.comment: the address at which to get the RegisterValue.

methods.name: getAddressRangeIterator
methods.comment:
Returns an AddressRangeIterator that will return address ranges everywhere that register values
 have been set within the given range.

params.name: startAddress
params.comment: the start address to get stored register values.

params.name: endAddress
params.comment: the end address to get stored register values.

return.comment:
an AddressRangeIterator that will return address ranges everywhere that register
 values have been set within the given range.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an AddressRangeIterator that will return address ranges everywhere that register
 values have been set.
@return an AddressRangeIterator that will return address ranges everywhere that register
 values have been set.
methods.name: getAddressRangeIterator
methods.comment:
Returns an AddressRangeIterator that will return address ranges everywhere that register
 values have been set.

return.comment:
an AddressRangeIterator that will return address ranges everywhere that register
 values have been set.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this store has no associated values for any address.
@return true if this store has no associated values for any address.
methods.name: isEmpty
methods.comment: Returns true if this store has no associated values for any address.

return.comment: true if this store has no associated values for any address.

methods.name: setLanguage
methods.comment: Preserve register values and handle register name/size change.

return.comment:
true if translated successfully, false if register not mapped 
 value storage should be discarded.

methods.name: getValueRangeContaining
methods.comment:
Returns the bounding address-range containing addr and the the same value throughout.
 This range will be limited by any value change associated with the base register.

name: RegisterValueStore
comment:
This is a generalized class for storing register values over ranges.  The values include mask bits
 to indicate which bits within the register are being set.  The mask is stored along with the
 value so the getValue method can indicate back which bits in the value are valid.  If existing
 values already exist at an address, the values are combined according to the masks.  Any new value
 bits that have their associated mask bits on will overwrite any existing bits and the new mask will
 be anded to the existing mask.  Other bits will not be affected.
 
 This class takes a RangeMapAdapter that will adapt to some lower level storage.  There are current
 two implementations - one that uses an ObjectRangeMap for storing register values in memory and
 the other that uses RangeMapDB for storing register values in the database.
